Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Counterpoise of menat necklace
Description: This bronze object constitutes the counterpoise of a menat-necklace, attributed to the goddess Hathor. Surmounted by the heads of Shu and Tefnut, the piece is composed of three parts: the upper part takes the form of a large half-moon necklace; the middle part, in the form of a square, shows a scene representing a person who makes an offering to a leontocephalic goddess; the lower part, rounded, represents a marshy enviroment with a basket on which is found a fish which holds the stalk of a lotus flower in its gills. The majority of the iconographical elements represented have close ties with the goddess Hathor.
